alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 1:18PM CDT until May 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of Iowa and southwest Wisconsin, including the following counties, in Iowa, Allamakee, Clayton, Howard, Mitchell and Winneshiek. In southwest Wisconsin, Crawford and Grant. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 115 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to persistent rain and a few thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain has fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to a quarter of an inch could fall this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Decorah, Prairie Du Chien, Waukon, Cresco, Postville, Monona, Calmar, McGregor, Ossian, Riceville, Garnavillo, Bloomington, Lime Springs, Stacyville, Marquette, Spillville, Harpers Ferry, Ridgeway, Farmersburg and Hardin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
